metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22590 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. Thisissue is fixed in iOS 15.3 and iPadOS 15.3, watchOS 8.4, tvOS 15.3, Safari15.3, macOS Monterey 12.2. Processing maliciously crafted web content maylead to arbitrary code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22590` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.34.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.34.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.34.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.34.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.34.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.34.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.34.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.34.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
wpewebkit package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
